conversation.speaker: White Witch
conversation.text: So you're finally here. It took them long enough.

conversation.speaker: White Witch
conversation.text: Of course. After all, we sacked your home. It was only a matter of time before they'd send you after me...

conversation.speaker: White Witch
conversation.text: ...the last bastion of the Fablewoods is a pathetic stray. Let me tell you something, kid.

conversation.speaker: White Witch
conversation.text: The reason we humans need your magic is to keep an ancient evil sealed. If it is released, the entire world will cease to be.

conversation.speaker: White Witch
conversation.text: You want the Elder Faerie back? Sure. You can have her on one condition: lay down your life as a catalyst. Your magical nature alone can keep the evil sealed for another 100 years.

conversation.speaker: Mimi
conversation.text: M-meow?! Meow... meow meow meow! (W-what?! That can't be true... I'm the lowest rank in my class. I was the last resort.)

conversation.speaker: Mimi
conversation.text: Meow meow—MEOW! (Even your students belittled me! Don't think I'll believe your lies now. Hand over the Elder Faerie or—OR WE'LL HAVE TO DO THIS THE HARD WAY!)

conversation.speaker: White Witch
conversation.text: ...haha...hahaha! It was silly of me to think I can reason with a stray. Fine then. I'll wring the magic out of you myself.
